page.title: 13Customs
page.content: An annual{custom}is the making of{ {pancakes,}which we eat on Shrove Tuesday in February.It originated when people used to mix fats,eggs and flour just before{Lent}so they could get rid of their rich food.Shrove Tuesday depends on the time of Easter Day, which is fixed by the movement of the moon. At{Easter}it is{customary}for relations and friends to give you chocolate eggs.Most people do not eat them until Easter Day. Another custom we have is{Bonfire {Night}which is on November fifth. Most people light a bonfire or go and watch a firework display.We have Bonfire Night to remember the time when{Guy {Fawkes}tried to blow up{Parliament,} but soldiers caught him and he was executed.
